div.head: Against dogs' mange
div.ab: For normal-sized dogs, take half an ℥ of stavesacre, & one ℥ for big dogs, as fine powder beaten with two egg whites & one quarteron of oil. They must drink the beverage on an empty stomach, after keeping them locked without any food. Approved.

div.head: For casting
div.ab: If you've got a big piece which does not allow an easy stripping of casting, mold it with some wax, either on the hollow side or in relief, because it is soft & hollow and so can easily be separated from the piece without leaving anything. But be sure that the melted wax is neither too hot nor too cold. Some people use for molding some wax warmed in boiled water, but while pressing the mold it bends & becomes unusable. Once you have made your wax cavity, you can cast in some very soft & clear clay, & let it dry. Then, upon it you will make a lead or tin cavity, in which what you will make will easily be stripped.
Know what it is to work on spangled garments, it is small pieces of pure silver & of silver-gilt with which one makes the archers' coats.

div.head: Spinet playing by itself
div.ab: Make an axle surrounded with wheels pierced all around in their thickness and attach feathers as for a cittern or a spinet & arrange them according to the song you want it to play, leaving a suitable distance. And, turning the axle either by yourself or by a clock spring, your invention will effect itself.
